alert.note: Alert for Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 4:21PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Hot Springs and northwestern Washakie Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 420 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles north of Legend Rock State Petroglyph Site to near Thermopolis. Movement was north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kirby and Winchester. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Riverton.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin
